title: Improved EPMA Analysis of Rare Earth and Trace Elements Using a New Precision Germanium WDS Crystal
content: Rigaku, Advanced Microbeam, and Concord University have cooperated to develop and field test a new high-performance “precision” germanium diffracting crystal design for wavelength dispersive spectrometers. Rigaku manufactured the crystal, and the first two prototypes are installed in electron microprobes at Advanced Microbeam and Concord University. The initial Ge crystal design uses a 111 orientation and covers a spectral range similar to PET but offset toward shorter X-ray wavelengths. A Ge 220 orientation is also possible and would cover a spectral range similar to LIF.
